Hi Eric, 
You might want to read here: http://crawler.archive.org/articles/=
user_manual/glossary.html#surtprefix. If you are using the SurtPrefixedDeci=
deRule, to get to the SURT prefix when there are 3 or more slashes in the U=
RL, everything after the last slash is truncated. You could try using a Mat=
chesRegExpDecideRule instead to match the pattern ^http://www.mysite.com/sh=
ow/artist.*$ instead.

Lauren Ko
Web Archiving Programmer
Digital Projects =
Unit
University of North Texas
________________________________________
Fro=
m: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Beh=
alf Of Eric Pugh [epugh@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 2=
9, 2009 8:56 AM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawl=
er] Filtering what is indexed based on URL's...

I am searching a site and =
I want to limit it to just a subset of urls
that match the pattern /show/ar=
tist. Right now it crawls anything.

I thought SURT logic would do it, but =
it doesn't seem to parse below
the www.mysite.com level of a URL... Or am I=
 understanding SURT
wrong? My SURT patterns were just done by pasting in a =
full URL and
seeing what came out.

Also, how would I filter archiving of i=
mages, css, etc.. I only want
HTML pages.

I am using Heretrix 2.0 (and qui=
te liking it!)

Eric
